concept.title: Testing the deployment by logging in to the application

titlealts.navtitle: Testing the deployment by logging in to the application

concept.shortdesc: When the application is deployed, log in to the application to display the application landing page, this action verifies basic functions of the application.

conbody.p: Ensure that the relevant server is started and enter the application URL in a web browser, for example:https://<some.machine.com>:<port>/<context-root>

Where the components of the URL are as follows:
<some.machine.com> identifies the hostname or IP address where is running.
<port> identifies the server port on which is listening. For more information, see curam.client.httpport in .
<context-root> identifies the context root of the WAR module, which would typically be Curam.
For the , the URL directs you to the application login page. Log in with a valid user name and password, the browser is then redirected to the application landing page.
Some applications, like the CitizenPortal context root, don't require an explicit login and the landing page is entered directly. For more information about CitizenPortal, see .
